t: Jeremiah 2
Israel Forsakes God
The*p word of the Lord*s came to me:

“Go and proclaim in the hearing of Jerusalem: “This*p is what the Lord*s says: “ ‘I*pn remember the devotion of your youth, how*ld as a bride you loved me and*ln followed me through the wilderness, through*ld a land not sown.
Israel*ln was holy to the Lord,*s the*ld firstfruits of his harvest; all*ln who devoured her were held guilty, and*ld disaster overtook them,’ ” declares*ld the Lord.*s
Hear*pn the word of the Lord,*s you descendants of Jacob, all*ld you clans of Israel.
This*p is what the Lord*s says: “What*pn fault did your ancestors find in me, that*ld they strayed so far from me? They*ln followed worthless idols and*ld became worthless themselves.

They*ln did not ask, ‘Where is the Lord,*s who*ld brought us up out of Egypt and*ln led us through the barren wilderness, through*ld a land of deserts and ravines, a*ln land of drought and utter darkness, a*ld land where no one travels and no one lives?’
I*ln brought you into a fertile land to*ld eat its fruit and rich produce. But*ln you came and defiled my land and*ld made my inheritance detestable.

The*ln priests did not ask, ‘Where*ld is the Lord?’*s Those*ln who deal with the law did not know me; the*ld leaders rebelled against me. The*ln prophets prophesied by Baal, following*ld worthless idols.
“Therefore*pn I bring charges against you again,” declares*ld the Lord.*s “And*ld I will bring charges against your children’s children.
Cross*ln over to the coasts of Cyprus and look, send*ld to Kedar and observe closely; see*ld if there has ever been anything like this:
Has*ln a nation ever changed its gods? (Yet*ld they are not gods at all.) But*ln my people have exchanged their glorious God for*ld worthless idols.
Be*ln appalled at this, you heavens, and*ld shudder with great horror,” declares*ld the Lord.*s
“My*pn people have committed two sins: They*ln have forsaken me, the*ld spring of living water, and*ln have dug their own cisterns, broken*ld cisterns that cannot hold water.
Is*ln Israel a servant, a slave by birth? Why*ld then has he become plunder?
Lions*ln have roared; they*ld have growled at him. They*ln have laid waste his land; his*ld towns are burned and deserted.
Also,*ln the men of Memphis and Tahpanhes have*ld cracked your skull.
Have*ln you not brought this on yourselves by*ld forsaking the Lord*s your God when*ld he led you in the way?
Now*ln why go to Egypt to*ld drink water from the Nile? And*ln why go to Assyria to*ld drink water from the Euphrates?

Your*ln wickedness will punish you; your*ld backsliding will rebuke you. Consider*ln then and realize how*ld evil and bitter it is for you when*ln you forsake the Lord*s your God and*ld have no awe of me,” declares*ld the Lord, the Lord*s Almighty.
“Long*pn ago you broke off your yoke and*ld tore off your bonds; you*ld said, ‘I will not serve you!’ Indeed,*ln on every high hill and*ld under every spreading tree you*ld lay down as a prostitute.
I*ln had planted you like a choice vine of*ld sound and reliable stock. How*ln then did you turn against me into*ld a corrupt, wild vine?
Although*ln you wash yourself with soap and*ld use an abundance of cleansing powder, the*ld stain of your guilt is still before me,” declares*ld the Sovereign Lord.*s

“How*pn can you say, ‘I am not defiled; I*ld have not run after the Baals’? See*ln how you behaved in the valley; consider*ld what you have done. You*ln are a swift she-camel running*ld here and there,

a*ln wild donkey accustomed to the desert, sniffing*ld the wind in her craving— in*ld her heat who can restrain her? Any*ln males that pursue her need not tire themselves; at*ld mating time they will find her.
Do*ln not run until your feet are bare and*ld your throat is dry. But*ln you said, ‘It’s no use! I*ld love foreign gods, and*ld I must go after them.’
“As*pn a thief is disgraced when he is caught, so*ld the people of Israel are disgraced— they,*ln their kings and their officials, their*ld priests and their prophets.

They*ln say to wood, ‘You are my father,’ and*ld to stone, ‘You gave me birth.’ They*ln have turned their backs to me and*ld not their faces; yet*ln when they are in trouble, they say, ‘Come*ld and save us!’
Where*ln then are the gods you made for yourselves? Let*ld them come if they can save you when*ld you are in trouble! For*ln you, Judah, have as many gods as*ld you have towns.
“Why*pn do you bring charges against me? You*ld have all rebelled against me,” declares*ld the Lord.*s
“In*pn vain I punished your people; they*ld did not respond to correction. Your*ln sword has devoured your prophets like*ld a ravenous lion.

“You*p of this generation, consider the word of the Lord:*s “Have*pn I been a desert to Israel or*ld a land of great darkness? Why*ln do my people say, ‘We are free to roam; we*ld will come to you no more’?
Does*ln a young woman forget her jewelry, a*ld bride her wedding ornaments? Yet*ln my people have forgotten me, days*ld without number.
How*ln skilled you are at pursuing love! Even*ld the worst of women can learn from your ways.
On*ln your clothes is found the*ld lifeblood of the innocent poor, though*ld you did not catch them breaking in. Yet*ln in spite of all this
you*ld say, ‘I am innocent; he*ld is not angry with me.’ But*ln I will pass judgment on you because*ld you say, ‘I have not sinned.’
Why*ln do you go about so much, changing*ld your ways? You*ln will be disappointed by Egypt as*ld you were by Assyria.
You*ln will also leave that place with*ld your hands on your head, for*ln the Lord*s has rejected those you trust; you*ld will not be helped by them.
